Snack : South Indian Recipe: Minapa Pindi Karallu Servings: 35 janthikallu Duration: 30 mins South Indian savory evening snack and one of the most authentic dish from India ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³Â It's crunchy and delicious made out of Urad Dal and rice flour along with cumin, sesame seeds and salt.. I hope you like it, Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Rice flour â€“ 500 gms
  • Urad Dal flour â€“ 200 gms
  • Hot oil - 2 tb sp ( to mix in flour )
  • Cumin seeds â€“ 1/2 tb sp
  • Sesame seeds â€“ 1 tb sp
  • Salt â€“ 1/2 tb sp
  • Water â€“ 320 ml
  • Oil â€“ To deep fry
Things:
  • Murukku Maker
  • 3 holes round shaped stainless steel jali
  • Wax paper
Procedure:
  • In a large mixing bowl add all ingredients
  • Mix well
  • Add water little by little and mix well
  • Make a soft & non sticky dough
  • Divide it into 4 to 5 cylinder shape, to put in Murukullu maker
  • Mean while, heat oil to deep fry on medium
  • Press Muruku as shown in picture ( like janthikallu )
  • Slowly, drop in oil
  • Flip both sides and take out they turn into light brown color
  • Repeat the process till dough completes
  • Store in an airtight container to remain fresh and crunchy
  • Serve at evening with family & friends ğŸ˜Š
  • Happy cooking ğŸ‘©ğŸ»â€ğŸ³and enjoy your day ğŸ™‚
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust salt according to taste
  • I used store bought Urad Dal flour
  • Instead of oil to add in flour you can also use melted butter 2 tb sp( it should be hot )
  • You can preserve upto 3 weeks
  • Prefer sunflower oil to deep fry than canola, olive , ground nut oil etc.,
